result.execSummary:
The defendant Hector K. Espino-Flores was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Hector K. Espino-Flores
parties.address: Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N. 9th St., Milwaukee, WI 53233

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.  **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-------------------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
-------------------------------

IT IS ORDERED, pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.015, that upon successful completion of the sentence imposed, as evidenced by receipt by this Court of a Certificate of Discharge from the probationary authority, AND WITH NO VIOLATIONS OF PROBATION that rise to the level of probable cause for a criminal offense, the Clerk of Court shall issue an order expunging the record.
-------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.  Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.

records.addlTxt: Minutes filed. Defendant Hector K. Espino-Flores in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Haley J Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant appears in court. Haley Rea appears for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Notice of Arrest
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):NO CONTACT WITH MARKET STREET CITGO.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
